commit.message:
configure.in: (gcc_cv_as_ia64_ltoffx_ldxmov_relocs): Fix quoting and insert missing empty...

	* configure.in: (gcc_cv_as_ia64_ltoffx_ldxmov_relocs): Fix quoting
	and insert missing empty argument.
	* configure: Regenerate.

From-SVN: r70242

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,9 @@
+2003-08-08  Andreas Schwab  <schwab@suse.de>
+
+	* configure.in: (gcc_cv_as_ia64_ltoffx_ldxmov_relocs): Fix quoting
+	and insert missing empty argument.
+	* configure: Regenerate.
+
 2003-08-07  John David Anglin  <dave.anglin@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca>
 
 	* pa.c (update_total_code_bytes): Use new macro IN_NAMED_SECTION_P.

@@ -6968,13 +6968,10 @@ fi
     echo '	.text
 	addl r15 = @ltoffx(x#), gp
 	;;
-	ld8.mov r16 = r15, x#' > conftest.s
+	ld8.mov r16 = [r15], x#' > conftest.s
     if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:6973: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
     then
-	    cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
-#define HAVE_AS_LTOFFX_LDXMOV_RELOCS 1
-EOF
-
+	gcc_cv_as_ia64_ltoffx_ldxmov_relocs=yes
     else
       echo "configure: failed program was" >&5
       cat conftest.s >&5
@@ -6984,7 +6981,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_as_ia64_ltoffx_ldxmov_relocs" 1>&6
+if test $gcc_cv_as_ia64_ltoffx_ldxmov_relocs = yes; then
+  cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
+#define HAVE_AS_LTOFFX_LDXMOV_RELOCS 1
+EOF
 
+fi
 
     ;;
 
@@ -6997,7 +6999,7 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_as_ia64_ltoffx_ldxmov_relocs" 1>&6
 	mfcr 3,128"
 
     echo $ac_n "checking assembler for mfcr field support""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7001: checking assembler for mfcr field support" >&5
+echo "configure:7003: checking assembler for mfcr field support" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_as_powerpc_mfcrf'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -7008,7 +7010,7 @@ else
 fi
   elif test x$gcc_cv_as != x; then
     echo "$conftest_s" > conftest.s
-    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7012: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
+    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7014: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
     then
 	gcc_cv_as_powerpc_mfcrf=yes
     else
@@ -7030,7 +7032,7 @@ fi
 
   mips*-*-*)
     echo $ac_n "checking assembler for explicit relocation support""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7034: checking assembler for explicit relocation support" >&5
+echo "configure:7036: checking assembler for explicit relocation support" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_as_mips_explicit_relocs'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -7041,7 +7043,7 @@ else
 fi
   elif test x$gcc_cv_as != x; then
     echo '	lw $4,%gp_rel(foo)($4)' > conftest.s
-    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7045: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
+    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7047: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
     then
 	gcc_cv_as_mips_explicit_relocs=yes
     else
@@ -7087,7 +7089,7 @@ if test x"$insn" != x; then
 	.loc 1 3 0
 	$insn"
  echo $ac_n "checking assembler for dwarf2 debug_line support""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7091: checking assembler for dwarf2 debug_line support" >&5
+echo "configure:7093: checking assembler for dwarf2 debug_line support" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_as_dwarf2_debug_line'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -7099,7 +7101,7 @@ else
 fi
   elif test x$gcc_cv_as != x; then
     echo "$conftest_s" > conftest.s
-    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7103: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
+    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7105: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
     then
 	# ??? This fails with non-gnu grep.  Maybe use objdump?
    if grep debug_line conftest.o > /dev/null 2>&1; then
@@ -7121,15 +7123,15 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_as_dwarf2_debug_line" 1>&6
 # by DW_AT_decl_file.  Approximate this test by testing if
 # the assembler bitches if the same index is assigned twice.
  echo $ac_n "checking assembler for buggy dwarf2 .file directive""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7125: checking assembler for buggy dwarf2 .file directive" >&5
+echo "configure:7127: checking assembler for buggy dwarf2 .file directive" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_as_dwarf2_file_buggy'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   gcc_cv_as_dwarf2_file_buggy=no
   if test x$gcc_cv_as != x; then
     echo '	.file 1 "foo.s"
 	.file 1 "bar.s"' > conftest.s
-    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7133: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
+    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as  -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7135: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
     then
 	gcc_cv_as_dwarf2_file_buggy=yes
     else
@@ -7152,7 +7154,7 @@ EOF
  fi
 
  echo $ac_n "checking assembler for --gdwarf2 option""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7156: checking assembler for --gdwarf2 option" >&5
+echo "configure:7158: checking assembler for --gdwarf2 option" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_as_gdwarf2_flag'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -7164,7 +7166,7 @@ else
 fi
   elif test x$gcc_cv_as != x; then
     echo "$insn" > conftest.s
-    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as --gdwarf2 -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7168: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
+    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as --gdwarf2 -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7170: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
     then
 	gcc_cv_as_gdwarf2_flag=yes
     else
@@ -7184,7 +7186,7 @@ EOF
 fi
 
  echo $ac_n "checking assembler for --gstabs option""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7188: checking assembler for --gstabs option" >&5
+echo "configure:7190: checking assembler for --gstabs option" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_as_gstabs_flag'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -7196,12 +7198,12 @@ else
 fi
   elif test x$gcc_cv_as != x; then
     echo "$insn" > conftest.s
-    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as --gstabs -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7200: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
+    if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as --gstabs -o conftest.o conftest.s >&5'; { (eval echo configure:7202: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
     then
 	# The native Solaris 9/Intel assembler doesn't understand --gstabs
    # and warns about it, but still exits successfully.  So check for
    # this.
-   if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as --gstabs -o conftest.o conftest.s 2>&1 | grep -i warning > /dev/null'; { (eval echo configure:7205: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
+   if { ac_try='$gcc_cv_as --gstabs -o conftest.o conftest.s 2>&1 | grep -i warning > /dev/null'; { (eval echo configure:7207: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }
    then :
    else gcc_cv_as_gstabs_flag=yes
    fi
@@ -7223,7 +7225,7 @@ fi
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking linker read-only and read-write section mixing""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7227: checking linker read-only and read-write section mixing" >&5
+echo "configure:7229: checking linker read-only and read-write section mixing" >&5
 gcc_cv_ld_ro_rw_mix=unknown
 if test $in_tree_ld = yes ; then
   if test "$gcc_cv_gld_major_version" -eq 2 -a "$gcc_cv_gld_minor_version" -ge 10 -o "$gcc_cv_gld_major_version" -gt 2 \
@@ -7262,7 +7264,7 @@ fi
 echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_ld_ro_rw_mix" 1>&6
 
 echo $ac_n "checking linker PT_GNU_EH_FRAME support""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7266: checking linker PT_GNU_EH_FRAME support" >&5
+echo "configure:7268: checking linker PT_GNU_EH_FRAME support" >&5
 gcc_cv_ld_eh_frame_hdr=no
 if test $in_tree_ld = yes ; then
   if test "$gcc_cv_gld_major_version" -eq 2 -a "$gcc_cv_gld_minor_version" -ge 12 -o "$gcc_cv_gld_major_version" -gt 2 \
@@ -7284,7 +7286,7 @@ fi
 echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_ld_eh_frame_hdr" 1>&6
 
 echo $ac_n "checking linker position independent executable support""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7288: checking linker position independent executable support" >&5
+echo "configure:7290: checking linker position independent executable support" >&5
 gcc_cv_ld_pie=no
 if test $in_tree_ld = yes ; then
   if test "$gcc_cv_gld_major_version" -eq 2 -a "$gcc_cv_gld_minor_version" -ge 15 -o "$gcc_cv_gld_major_version" -gt 2 \
@@ -7309,7 +7311,7 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_ld_pie" 1>&6
 case "$target" in
   mips*-*-*)
     echo $ac_n "checking whether libgloss uses STARTUP directives consistently""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7313: checking whether libgloss uses STARTUP directives consistently" >&5
+echo "configure:7315: checking whether libgloss uses STARTUP directives consistently" >&5
     gcc_cv_mips_libgloss_startup=no
     gcc_cv_libgloss_srcdir=`echo $srcdir | sed -e 's,/gcc$,,'`/libgloss
     if test "x$exec_prefix" = xNONE; then
@@ -7514,7 +7516,7 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether to enable maintainer-specific portions of Makefiles""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7518: checking whether to enable maintainer-specific portions of Makefiles" >&5
+echo "configure:7520: checking whether to enable maintainer-specific portions of Makefiles" >&5
     # Check whether --enable-maintainer-mode or --disable-maintainer-mode was given.
 if test "${enable_maintainer_mode+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_maintainer_mode"

@@ -2262,12 +2262,10 @@ changequote([,])dnl
   ia64*-*-*)
     gcc_GAS_CHECK_FEATURE([ltoffx and ldxmov relocs],
 	gcc_cv_as_ia64_ltoffx_ldxmov_relocs, [2,14,0],,
-changequote(<<,>>)dnl
-<<	.text
+[	.text
 	addl r15 = @ltoffx(x#), gp
 	;;
-	ld8.mov r16 = [r15], x#>>,
-changequote([,])dnl
+	ld8.mov r16 = [[r15]], x#],,
     [AC_DEFINE(HAVE_AS_LTOFFX_LDXMOV_RELOCS, 1,
 	  [Define if your assembler supports ltoffx and ldxmov relocations.])])
